Tarvent is an email marketing, automatio: Tarvent is an email marketing, automation, and email API platform that allows to you to send campaigns, manage contacts, automate your marketing, and more.
\nTo obtain your Tarvent Account ID and:
To obtain your Tarvent Account ID and API Key, follow these steps:

1. Log in to your Tarvent account.
2. Go to **Account->API Keys** section.
3. **Create an API key** and copy it. Make sure to give it the correct permissions.
4. The **Account ID** is available to copy at the top right
Add/Remove A Contact From A Journey: Add/Remove A Contact From A Journey

Sends a copy of a campaign.

Finds an audience group by name.
Creates a suppression filter in your acc: Creates a suppression filter in your account to suppress a contact.

Finds a custom event by name.

Enter the contacts email. NOTE: If the a: Enter the contacts email. NOTE: If the audience uses a custom contact identifier and overwrite is enabled, then this will update the FIRST contact that matches the email.
Update the contact's profile if it alrea: Update the contact's profile if it already exists. Otherwise, return the "Duplicate" error.
Select whether to replace or only add to: Select whether to replace or only add to contact groups. NOTE: Add only will only add the contact to the groups they are not already in. Replace will remove the contact from all existing groups and add them to the selected groups.

Select whether to replace or only add to contact tags of an existing contact. NOTE: Add only will only add the tags the contact does not already have. Replace will replace all contact tags with the entered tags.
Select which tags you would like to add: Select which tags you would like to add to the contact.
If specified, the trigger will only fire: If specified, the trigger will only fire if contact is in the selected audience.
Find this in the edit contact dialog on: Find this in the edit contact dialog on the details page.
Select whether to add or remove tags.
Enter which tags you would like to add o: Enter which tags you would like to add or remove.

Select which journey to start or stop.

NOTE: Variable names (first column) can: NOTE: Variable names (first column) can have Letters, numbers, underscores, and hyphens. Any other characters in the first column only will be removed.
Select which template you'd like to used: Select which template you'd like to used for this transaction.
If \"Template\" is specified, this will: If "Template" is specified, this will be ignored..
To merge in variables, you must use the: To merge in variables, you must use the syntax [[Tx.VariableData.VariableName]] (ex. Variable name is FirstName, merge syntax would be [[Tx.VariableData.FirstName]]) If "Template" is specified, this will be ignored.
Select if the suppression filters on you: Select if the suppression filters on your account should be ignored for this transaction.
Select which campaign to send. **NOTE:**: Select which campaign to send. **NOTE:** Make sure all campaign settings are correct (from, subject, content) before configuring this automation.
Find an audience by searching using its: Find an audience by searching using its name.
Find an audience by searching using its tags. To search using multiple tags, separate the tags with a comma.
Enter the email to add to the suppressio: Enter the email to add to the suppression list.
Use the description to describe why this: Use the description to describe why this contact is being suppressed.
Find a campaign by searching using its n: Find a campaign by searching using its name.
Find a campaign by searching using its t: Find a campaign by searching using its tags. To search using multiple tags, separate the tags with a comma.
Search for a contact by email. If the au: Search for a contact by email. If the audience uses a custom contact identifier, then the search returns the FIRST contact that matches the email address. To target a specific contact, please use the contact's ID.
Find a custom event by searching using i: Find a custom event by searching using its name.
Find a journey by searching using its na: Find a journey by searching using its name.

Triggers when a contact is added to the: Triggers when a contact is added to the selected audience.
Triggers when a contact is added or remo: Triggers when a contact is added or removed from a group.
Triggers when a contact's profile is upd: Triggers when a contact's profile is updated.
Triggers when a contact's status changes: Triggers when a contact's status changes.
Triggers when a tag is added or removed: Triggers when a tag is added or removed from a contact.
Triggers when a note is added to a conta: Triggers when a note is added to a contact.
Triggers when a contact unsubscribes fro: Triggers when a contact unsubscribes from an audience.
Triggers when a known or unknown contact: Triggers when a known or unknown contact submits a sign up, profile update, or other form.
Triggers when a known or unknown contact performs a Call-To-Action within a landing page.
Triggers when a known or unknown contact submits a survey.
Triggers when a link within a campaign o: Triggers when a link within a campaign or transactional email is clicked by a recipient.
Triggers when a campaign or transactiona: Triggers when a campaign or transactional email is opened by a recipient.
Triggers when a campaign or transactional email bounces (is rejected) for a contact.
Triggers when a campaign has been sent t: Triggers when a campaign has been sent to a contact. WARNING: This will fire for every contact the campaign is sent to, please be careful using this trigger.
Triggers when a transactional email is c: Triggers when a transactional email is created for a known or unknown contact.
Triggers when a transactional email is p: Triggers when a transactional email is processed and sent to one or more recipients.
Select what status should fire this trig: Select what status should fire this trigger.
If not included, only the contact ID, em: If not included, only the contact ID, email and unique identifier will be passed back.
If specified, the trigger will only fire: If specified, the trigger will only fire if contact is in the selected group.
If specified, the trigger will only fire if contact has the selected tag.
Select if the trigger should fire when a: Select if the trigger should fire when a contact is added or removed.
Select if the trigger should fire when a tag is added or removed.
If specified, the trigger will only fire: If specified, the trigger will only fire if the selected form is submitted.
If specified, the trigger will only fire if CTA (call-to-action) is performed on the selected landing page.
If specified, the trigger will only fire if the selected survey is submitted.
Select if a campaign, transactional emai: Select if a campaign, transactional email or both should fire the trigger.
Select what campaign(s) should fire the: Select what campaign(s) should fire the trigger.
Only used if campaign type is set to \"S: Only used if campaign type is set to "Specific"
Only used if campaign type is set to "Specific". If specified, the trigger will only fire if a contact clicks the selected link.
Select which bounce type should fire the: Select which bounce type should fire the trigger.
